edu.umn.cs.spatialHadoop.core

Class SpatialSite

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umn.cs.spatialHadoop.core.SpatialSite

  • public class SpatialSite
extends Object
    Combines all the configuration needed for SpatialHadoop.
    Author:
    Ahmed Eldawy

      • NonHiddenFileFilter

        public static final org.apache.hadoop.fs.PathFilter NonHiddenFileFilter
        A filter that selects visible files and filters out hidden files. Hidden files are the ones with a names starting in '.' or '_'

      • RTreeFileMarker

        public static final long RTreeFileMarker
        A marker put in the beginning of each block to indicate that this block is stored as an RTree. It might be better to store this in the BlockInfo in a field (e.g. localIndexType).

        Constant Field Values

        public static void setClass(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
            String key,
            Class<?> klass,
            Class<?> xface)
        It sets the given class in the configuration and, in addition, it sets the jar of that class to the class path of this job which allows it to run correctly in a distributed mode.
        Parameters:
        conf - - Configuration to set the key
        key - - the key to set
        klass - - the class to use as a value
        xface - - the interface that the provided class should implement

      • addClassToPath

        public static void addClassToPath(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                  Class<?> klass)
        Ensures that the given class is in the class path of running jobs. If the jar is not already in the class path, it is added to the DisributedCache of the given job to ensure the associated job will work fine.
        Parameters:
        conf -
        klass -

      • createStockShape

        public static Shape createStockShape(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration job)
        Creates a stock shape according to the given configuration. It is a shortcut to getShape(Configuration, String) called for this configuration and with the given parameter name.
        Parameters:
        job -
        Returns:

      • setShape

        public static void setShape(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
            String param,
            Shape shape)
        Deprecated. Use OperationsParams.setShape(Configuration,String,Shape) instead
        Sets the specified configuration parameter to the current value of the shape. Both class name and shape values are encoded in one string and set as the value of the configuration parameter. The shape can be retrieved later using getShape(Configuration, String).
        Parameters:
        conf -
        param -
        shape -

      • getShape

        @Deprecated
public static Shape getShape(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                        String param)
        Deprecated. - Use OperationsParams.getShape(Configuration, String)
        Retrieves a value of a shape set earlier using OperationsParams.setShape(Configuration, String, Shape). It reads the corresponding parameter and parses it to find the class name and shape value. First, a default object is created using Class.newInstance() then the value is parsed using TextSerializable.fromText(Text).
        Parameters:
        conf -
        param -
        Returns:

      • getGlobalIndex

        public static GlobalIndex<Partition> getGlobalIndex(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem fs,
                                    org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path dir)
        Returns the global index (partitions) of a file that is indexed using the index command. If the file is not indexed, it returns null. The return value is of type GlobalIndex where the generic parameter is specified as Partition.
        Parameters:
        fs -
        dir -
        Returns:

      • isRTree

        public static boolean isRTree(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem fs,
              org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path path)
                       throws IOException
        Checks whether a file is indexed using an R-tree or not. This allows an operation to use the R-tree to speedup the processing if it exists. This function opens the specified file and reads the first eight bytes which include the R-tree signature. If the signatures matches with the R-tree signature, true is returned. Otherwise, false is returned. If the parameter is a path to a directory, only the first data file in that directory is tested.
        Parameters:
        fs -
        path -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • cellsOf

        public static CellInfo[] cellsOf(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem fs,
                 org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path path)
                          throws IOException
        Returns the cells (partitions) of a file. This functionality can be useful to repartition another file using the same partitioning or to draw these partitions as a high level index. This function reads the master file and returns all rectangles in it.
        Parameters:
        fs -
        path -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setCells

        public static void setCells(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
            CellInfo[] cellsInfo)
                     throws IOException
        Set an array of cells in the job configuration. As the array might be very large to store as one value, an alternative approach is used. The cells are all written to a temporary file, and that file is added to the DistributedCache of the job. Later on, a call to getCells(Configuration) will open the corresponding file from DistributedCache and parse cells from that file.
        Parameters:
        conf -
        cellsInfo -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getCells

        public static CellInfo[] getCells(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
                           throws IOException
        Retrieves cells that were stored earlier using setCells(Configuration, CellInfo[]) This function opens the corresponding file from DistributedCache and parses jobs from it.
        Parameters:
        conf -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • cellsOf

        public static CellInfo[] cellsOf(GlobalIndex<Partition> gIndex)
        Finds the partitioning info used in the given global index. If each cell is represented as one partition, the MBRs of these partitions are returned. If one cell is stored in multiple partitions (i.e., multiple files), their MBRs are combined to produce one MBR for this cell.
        Parameters:
        gIndex -
        Returns:
